intro: Scyphogyne tenuis, commonly known as the slender scyphogyne, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Scyphogyne tenuis is considered a species of conservation concern.
